sentences: Käskisin pool kriipsu põhja poole pidada.
Tema ei tagane oma nõudmisest mitte kriipsugi.
Ma ei kahtle selles mitte kriipsugi.
context: The word 'käskisin' is the first-person singular past tense form of the Estonian verb 'käskima', which means 'to command', 'to instruct', or 'to order'. In the provided example sentence from H. Sergo, it appears in context with kriips (line/mark) where someone is giving an instruction about positioning a steering wheel or similar object halfway down. The dictionary definition shows this word used in an instructional context.
